meanings.definition: A support placed at the end of a row of books to keep them upright.
meanings.sent1: I used a bookend to keep my books standing straight on the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The bookend held up the heavy books on the bookshelf.
meanings.sent3: The bookend looked like a tiny tower holding up the books.
meanings.sent4: The bookend was a sturdy pillar supporting the books.
meanings.sent5: The bookend was like a guardian protecting the books from falling.

meanings.definition: To be positioned at the beginning and end of something.
meanings.sent1: I will bookend the presentation with a strong opening and closing.
meanings.sent2: She likes to bookend her day with a morning walk and an evening meditation.
meanings.sent3: He tends to bookend his meals with a dessert at the start and end.
meanings.sent4: The movie bookended the story with scenes from the protagonist's childhood.
meanings.sent5: The song bookends with a beautiful melody that echoes in your mind.
